column4: well, I haven't heard of any software issues that would cause that between that version and that CPU PhibreOptix
so, anyone know why Cedega locks up Ubuntu-64 entirely, leaving a hard reset as the only solution?
I can't even get past the Licence Agreement page :(
is Cedega even meant to be 64bit compatible?
is it a fresh installation, or has it worked previously?
it's an upgraded 8.04 -> 8.10, and yes, it did work
have you tried with another user?
yes, that doesn't work, xfce does work however
has your upgrade completed? If in doubt, try 'sudo apt-get -f install ; sudo dpkg --configure -a'
I did have some interruptions during the upgrade, one hard-lock, but I've since recovered from it otherwise sucessfully, everything you mentioned checks out ok
the last line includes a "Gdk-CRITICAL" dealing with gnome-screensaver-gl-helper
perhaps it's hanging on that very program. You could enter your login details, switch to the text console and check with ps whether it's running, and possibly kill it.
dpkg returned an error trying to reinstall gnome-screensaver, exit status 245
interesting -- look at /var/lib/dpkg/info/gnome-screensaver.postinst to see what it's doing when it throws the 245
or maybe it's another gnome-screensaver.* script -- you should be able to tell from the dpkg output
thanks for getting me on the right track, I ran sudo gconf-schemas --register /usr/share/gconf/schemas/* and then sudo apt-get install --reinstall gnome-screensaver, works flawlessly now! :-D
interesting. How did you find the gconf-schemas thing?
